Layered potassium magnesium and calcium phosphates were prepared as described below. K-LMP was first synthesised using a MgCl 2-K 2HPO 4-H 2O system as described previously
21 . The resulting crystals ranged in size from 10−20 μm, and the particle size was too large and therefore unsuitable for lubrication
22, 23 . In order to obtain a suitable particle size, various magnesium sources were chosen for K-LMP synthesis (Fig. 4). K-LMP platelets with a particle size of ~2.0 μm were obtained by replacing magnesium chloride with magnesium hydroxide. The low solubility and high alkalinity of magnesium hydroxide may play a key role in controlling particle size. Detailed synthesis conditions are shown in Supplementary Table S1. By changing the synthesis conditions, K-LMP can be prepared using a feed ratio range P/Mg = 2.0–2.2, H 2O/Mg = 15–30, and a temperature range 100–150 °C in 24 h.
